item.title: Memory loss: As AI gobbles up chips, prices for devices may rise
item.description: Demand for memory chips currently exceeds supply and there's very little chance of that changing any time soon. More chips for AI means less available for other products such as computers and phones and that could drive up those prices too.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, sex goddess of cinema, has died
item.description: Legendary screen siren and animal rights activist Brigitte Bardot has died at age 91. The alluring former model starred in numerous movies, often playing the highly sexualized love interest.

item.title: For Ukrainians, a nuclear missile museum is a bitter reminder of what the country gave up
item.description: The Museum of Strategic Missile Forces tells the story of how Ukraine dismantled its nuclear weapons arsenal after independence in 1991. Today many Ukrainians believe that decision to give up nukes was a mistake.

item.title: Zelenskyy to meet with Trump as efforts to end Russia-Ukraine war remain elusive
item.description: In the days before the meeting, Russia has intensified its attacks on Ukraine's capital, using missiles and drones to attack Kyiv and try to increase the pressure on Zelenskyy.

item.title: Winter storm brings heavy snow and ice to busy holiday travel weekend
item.description: A powerful winter storm is impacting parts of the U.S. with major snowfall, ice, and below zero wind chills. The conditions are disrupting holiday travel and could last through next week.

item.title: 'It's behind you!' How Britain goes wild for pantomimes during the holidays
item.description: Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.

item.title: Kennedy Center vows to sue musician who canceled performance over Trump name change
item.description: The Kennedy Center is planning legal action after jazz musician Chuck Redd canceled an annual holiday concert. Redd pulled out after President Trump's name appeared on the building.
